Committee of Public Accounts

The Committee of Public Accounts is appointed by the House of Commons to examine public expenditure and accounts laid before Parliament. The committee is currently chaired by Sir Geoffrey Clifton-Brown, a Conservative MP from North Cotswolds.

Key Concepts:

  • Accountability
  • Public expenditure
  • Parliamentary oversight
  • Skills challenge faced by government
  • Digital-first operating model
  • Competitiveness of digital staff
  • Monitoring and evaluation of reforms
Committee of Public Accounts House of Commons Standing Orders digital skills gap reforms public sector private sector digital transformation
